title: Use uploaded images as default homepage and modal images

requirements.summary: Add the two user-uploaded images to frontend static assets so they ship in production builds and are loaded without the backend.
acceptanceCriteria: The app loads these images via `/assets/generated/IMG_20260208_030749.jpg` and `/assets/generated/image.jpg` without going through the backend.

file_operations.description: Add the provided uploaded image to the static public assets folder so it is emitted in production builds.
Add the provided uploaded image to the static public assets folder so it is emitted in production builds.

requirements.summary: Switch the homepage couple-photo fallback image to the uploaded IMG_20260208_030749.jpg while keeping the existing file picker behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: On a fresh load (no user selection), the homepage image area shows `IMG_20260208_030749.jpg`.
The existing homepage image picker continues to work and can override the default image with a user-selected file.

file_operations.description: Update the `useClientImagePreview(...)` defaultSrc to `/assets/generated/IMG_20260208_030749.jpg` so the homepage uses the uploaded image as the initial fallback before any user file selection.

requirements.summary: Switch the popup modal fallback image to the uploaded image.jpg while keeping the existing modal file picker behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: When the user clicks “Yes” to open the modal, the modal image area shows `image.jpg` by default.
The existing modal image picker continues to work and can override the default image with a user-selected file.

file_operations.description: Update the `useClientImagePreview(...)` defaultSrc to `/assets/generated/image.jpg` so the modal uses the uploaded image as the initial fallback before any user file selection.
